solution: The number of squares in the rectangles is an arithmetic sequence with first term 1 and common difference 1. Thus, at Stage 6, there will be 6 squares. Since each square has an area of $3 \cdot 3 = 9$ square inches, the total area of the rectangle at Stage 6 is $6 \cdot 9 = \boxed{54}$ square inches.
model_solution:
At each stage, the number of 3'' by 3'' squares increases by 1. 

At Stage 1, there is 1 square, so the area is 1 * 9 = 9 square inches.
At Stage 2, there are 2 squares, so the area is 2 * 9 = 18 square inches.

At Stage 3, there are 3 squares, so the area is 3 * 9 = 27 square inches.

At Stage 4, there will be 4 squares, so the area is 4 * 9 = 36 square inches.

At Stage 5, there will be 5 squares, so the area is 5 * 9 = 45 square inches.

At Stage 6, there will be 6 squares, so the area is 6 * 9 = 54 square inches.
At Stage 7, there will be 7 squares, so the area is 7 * 9 = 63 square inches.
At Stage 8, there will be 8 squares, so the area is 8 * 9 = 72 square inches.
At Stage 9, there will be 9 squares, so the area is 9 * 9 = 81 square inches.
At Stage 6, there will be 6 squares, so the area is 6 * 9 = 54 square inches.
